basics.name: Joshua Pedersen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii, Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

courses: ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I (Object-Oriented Programming)
ICS 211: Introduction to Computer Science II (Data Structures)
ICS 141: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science I
ICS 241: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science II

work.summary: Assist students with precalculus homework and recitation worksheets. Provide guidance and clarification on mathematical concepts and problem-solving strategies.
highlights: Set up and manage regular office hours outside of the classroom to offer personalized assistance to students. Address studentsâ€™ questions and concerns related to math coursework.
Tutor, providing one-on-one, group, and in-class tutoring sessions to help students understand complex math concepts.

work.position: Research Assistant in Cognitive and Translational Neuroscience
work.summary: Preprocess and analyze EEG data of substance-exposed neonates
highlights: Utilized FASTER EEGLAB, FieldTrip, and MATLAB functions for preprocessing and artifact removal, including bad channel identification and interpolation.
Focused on identifying and analyzing the MMN component within the Event-Related Potentials (ERPs) to determine the neonates' ability to perceive differences in sounds.
Developed MATLAB scripts to automate EEG data preprocessing, filtering, and MMN extraction, improving efficiency and accuracy in data analysis.

work.summary: Successfully annotated results of complex datasets
highlights: Understanding of cybersecurity concepts and methodologies
Worked with project members to refine annotation guidelines, enhancing the quality and consistency of annotated data.
Gained experience using Ubuntu OS through VirtualBox.
Practiced and learned cybersecurity fundamentals and ethical hacking skills.
Participated in team-based hacking competition for the National Cyber League (NCL), placing in the top 5%.

awards.title: Member of the Year
awards.summary: Actively participating in club activities, regularly attending meetings. Contributed to club activities and competitions.

awards.title: OLA Award (Outstanding Learning Assistant
awards.awarder: Learning Assistant Program at University of Hawai'i at Manoa
awards.summary: Award recognizes Learning Assistants who have distinguished contributions to the course(s) they serve, by demonstrating excellence in helping create healthy and engaging learning environments while providing meaningful support to students and faculty.

awards.title: LA Team Excellence Award
awards.awarder: Learning Assistant Program at University of Hawai'i at Manoa
awards.summary: The LA Team Excellence Award recognizes outstanding collaborative efforts by Learning Assistant teams who exemplify exceptional collaboration in supporting course instructors, and enhancing student learning outcomes.

awards.title: Deans List
awards.summary: Semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Phi Theta Kappa Honors Society
awards.summary: International honor society of students attending open-access institutions and seeking further education.
